title: As a user I want to be able to search for professional players by MLS
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user advanced search for "Professional Players"
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a filter option for "MLS" (major league service)
AND The user should have the ability to enter in service in the format 0.000, though decimals should not be required. (In other words if they search for MLS between 2 and 3, just assume they mean 2.000 and 3.000)
AND They should not be able to enter more decimals than that and no more than 99.999.
AND Available operators should match that of other NUM filters we have (See MJC Guaranteed Years filter for an example). 
AND Searching for professional players with this filter applied should only return professional players that match the applied filter(s).

Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Search+-+Professionals

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Under the Advanced Search for "Professional Players"

title: As a user I want to be able to quicksearch for Employees
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user click on the Quick Search dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN user will see an option for "Employees"
AND This should display first since the list is alphabetical, but the default should remain Professional Players. 
AND Selecting "Employees" should allow the user to quickly search for Employees by entering in text per the requirements. 
AND The population returned should be limited to employees that are currently active (Active or Active, Not Under Contract) or have been active within the past 2 years (determined by last transaction date). 
AND The population should be ordered according to the search requirements.

Search Requirements: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Quick+Search+Population+rules

title: As an EBIS team member I want to be able to update EBIS Link-cached Major Contracts transactions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in
AND navigate to the EBIS Link page
custom_steps: WHEN click on a dropdown option for "Update transaction by ID" that takes a comma-separated list of IDs.
custom_expected: THEN Submitting this request should cause the indicated transactions to be re-cached in EBIS Link.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to run the Waiver Results for MLBPA Report
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Waiver+Results+for+MLBPA+Report+Layout
Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Waiver+Results+for+MLBPA+Report+Details
Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=125461292
Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Waiver+Results+for+MLBPA+Report+Prompts
GIVEN "Waiver Result Report for MLBPA" is a report in the Report listing widget
custom_steps: WHEN user selects this report from the widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should launch the prompts according to the requirements
AND this should be a BOC only report (club user should not have access)
AND the category of this report should be "Waivers"
AND entering the desired prompts and running the report should work and match the wiki requirements above 
AND the report should have an LDAP associated with it (test_boc_approver@mlb.com should have this LDAP)

title: As a user I want to be able to view an Offseason Assignment for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Viewer permission for an Offseason Assignment for an employee
AND user Advance Search for an Offseason Assignment Transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opes an Offseason Assignment transaction
custom_expected:
THEN If any Offseason Assignment transactions existed for employees in ebis1, we need to build the UI and ETL them to ebis2. 
AND user should see that the UI has 1 additional field (Designate As), but otherwise matches that of the player transaction. 
AND user should not be able to enter new, edit, save these transactions.

Wireframe:
https://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=offseason_assignment

title: As a user I want to be able to view a list of all available trainer/agent profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with Viewer permissions for a list of all available trainer/agent profiles
custom_steps: WHEN user click on the "International" tab
custom_expected:
THEN user should see L1 Reg tab as the default landing tab
AND user should see Trainer/Agents widget available
AND The widget matches the provided data discovery and wireframe.
AND It is populated with the database of available Approved trainer/agents.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=trainer_agent_widget

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347879

Acceptance Criteria:

title: As a user I want to be able to view a Trainer/Agent profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with either editors or viewers permissions for a list of all available trainer/agent profiles
AND user navigate to the "International" page
custom_steps: WHEN user click on a profile from the trainer/ agent widget or from International Trainer search
custom_expected:
THEN the system will load the trainer/agent profile per the data discovery and wireframe.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347878

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=trainer_agent_profile

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a trainer/agent profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with delete permissions for trainer/agent profiles 
AND user navigates to L1 Reg tab under International
AND user select a trainer/agent from the widget and opens the trainer/agent profile in view or edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN click "Delete" button
custom_expected:
THEN System will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the profile.
AND If they confirm, then the status is updated to "Deleted", and the trainer/agent profile no longer appears as an option on registration profiles, or in the trainer/agents widget. 
AND A blue notification is thrown confirming the deletion

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=trainer_agent_profile

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Trainer/Agent profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for trainer/agent profiles
AND user navigates to L1 Reg tab under International
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Create New" button on the Trainer/Agent widget
custom_expected:
THEN System will loads a blank trainer/agent profile for the user, per the wire and data discovery. 
AND When on the trainer/agent form there is a save button and a cancel button available. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are OK losing their changes. If they confirm, the system will discard the profile and return the user to the point of entry. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 
OR Clicking "Save" will run a required field and format check for the profile and save the profile. 
AND The profile will be assigned a status of "Approved" and be visible in the trainer/agent widget, as well as the International Trainer search.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=create_a_new_trainer_agent

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347878

title: As a user I want to create a new Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Create New" on International dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN System will load Create New Player form.
AND user will see the "Register" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered. 
AND The National ID fields are conditionally required based on the selection of "Birth Country", and this should be reflected via the red asterisks displayed on the UI. 
AND Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB on or after 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new registration profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. 
AND There are a lot of conditionally displayed fields on these profiles, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
AND The Registration Reviews and Means of Contact sections are not visible on create. 
AND Any action buttons and calculated fields (Eligible to Sign date/Meets Age Requirements) are handled in follow up stories.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a user I want to save a new Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND User is in the create new player form
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Save" on the new Registration profile form
custom_expected:
THEN The system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and a blue successful save notification is thrown. 
AND Fields are conditionally required, especially upload labels, so the data discovery should be paid special attention. 
AND The Registration status should be set to "Pending BOC Review" on save.
OR If the user Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 


Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a user I want the system to calculate the Meets Age Requirements On date for a new Registration profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is in create a new player profile form
custom_steps: WHEN a user click "Next" or "Register" from the Create New form
custom_expected:
THEN the system should calculate the Meets Age Requirement date per the provided business rules. 
AND This date should also be recalculated on any save in case of changes to the DOB during the create process. 
AND This field is not editable by users.

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Requirement

title: As a user I want the system to calculate the Eligible Sign to Date for a Registration profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged with Admin permissions for Registration profile
AND user is in the create new player form
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Next" or "Register" from the the Create New Player form
custom_expected:
THEN the system should calculate the Eligible to Sign date per the provided business rules. 
AND This date should also be recalculated on initial save in case of changes to the DOB during the create process. 
AND BOC users are able to edit the Eligible to Sign date after initial save, and it is important that any changes they make not be overwritten by the system with a recalc.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Requirement

title: As a user I want to create a new Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the International Dashboard
custom_expected:
On the International dashboard there is a "Create New" form available, per the wireframe.
The "Next" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered.
The National ID fields are conditionally required based on the selection of "Birth Country", and this should be reflected via the red asterisks displayed on the UI.
Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB before 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new grandfathered profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. (the far right column describes Grandfathered profiles)
Any action buttons and calculated fields (Eligible to Sign date/Meets Age Requirements) are handled in follow up stories.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered_-_hidden_profile

title: As a user I want to save a new Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with edit Grandfathered profile permissions
AND User has navigated to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Grandfathered profile in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button available as well as a "Cancel" button.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 
OR If the user clicks "Save", then the system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and throws a blue successful save notification.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered_-_hidden_profile

custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Grandfathered profile
custom_expected:
THEN system will display the Player Profile Header, the Bio Info and Scouting Info per the Data Discovery and provided wireframe.  (the far right column in the data discovery indicates which fields are not included for Grandfathered profiles)

*Note that grandfathered profiles are international amateurs with a DOB before 9/1/1995*

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered_-_hidden_profile

*Note that grandfathered profiles are international amateurs with a DOB before 9/1/1995*

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC and Club user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Grandfathered profile
custom_expected:
THEN system will display the National ID section per the Data Discovery and provided wireframe.  (the far right column in the data discovery indicates which fields are not included for Grandfathered profiles)

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

title: As a BOC user I want to view the Bio Info of an existing Registration profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user logged in with Viewer permissions for Registration profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display the player profile header, and the Bio Info (not including Scouting Info) per the Data Discovery and provided wireframe. 
AND There is a "BOC Notes" comments box at the bottom of the profile.

*Note that registration profiles are international amateurs with a DOB on or after 9/1/1995*

custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Viewer permissions for Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens an existing Registration profile
custom_expected:

AND The Scouting Info section only appears for Registration profiles that have an MLSB entry or Scouting report attached OR have passed their Eligible to Sign date.

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Viewer permissions for existing registration profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration profile
custom_expected:

custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display the Registration Reviews section per the Data Discovery and provided wireframe. 
AND The Means of Contact section is not displayed unless the profile has been verified at least once.

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

title: As a BOC user I want to view the Attached Files for an existing Registration profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Viewer Permissions for Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display the Attached Files per the Data Discovery and provided wireframe. 
AND The toggle ability is covered in another story. 
*Note that registration profiles are international amateurs with a DOB on or after 9/1/1995*

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

title: As a BOC user I want to view the different Contact Information for a registration profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Viewer Permissions for Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration profile
custom_expected:
THEN user will have an "Origin" toggle as part of the Contact Information section of the profile.
AND By default this will load the "Master" version if available.
AND If "Master" is not available, then the BOC version should be loaded.
OR If a BOC version is not available, load the first entered version.
AND All available versions of the saved contact information should be available via the Toggle.
AND Changing the toggle to another selection should load the selected set of Contact Information. 
AND "Contact Information" entails the address section, email address section, trainer/agent/league section and the  phone number section.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a BOC user I want to view the different Attached Files for a registration profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Viewer Permissions for Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN User will have an "Origin" toggle as part of the Attached Files section of the profile.
AND By default, this will load the "Master" version if available.
AND If "Master" is not available, then the BOC version should be loaded.
OR If a BOC version is not available, load the first entered version.
AND All available versions of attached files should be available via the Toggle.
AND Changing the toggle to another selection should load the selected set of Attached Files.  
AND Changing the Attached Files toggle will also set the Contact Info toggle, and vice versa.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a Club user I want to view an existing Registration profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN club user is logged in with Viewer Permissions for existing Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display per the Data Discovery and provided wireframe. 

*Note that registration profiles are international amateurs with a DOB on or after 9/1/1995*

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a Club user I want to view multiple sets of Contact Info/Attached Files on an existing Registration profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user is logged in with Viewer Permissions for Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens an existing Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display an Origin toggle in the Attached Files and the Contact Info sections ONLY IF the profile has more than one set of information that is visible to the Club. 
AND This will only happen if both sets of Contact Information have an Origin = the viewing Club user (only achieved through a profile merge). 
AND If the toggle exists, then the user should see the option to flip between the sets of Contact Information, just like the BOC does. 
AND The default one should be first in. 

*Note that registration profiles are international amateurs with a DOB on or after 9/1/1995*

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master

title: As a user I want the system to determine whether the player I'm creating a profile for is subject to registration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user is logged in with Create Permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is navigate to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "New Player"
custom_expected:
THEN the system will load the "Create New" form where the user can begin the process of creating a new International Amateur profile.
AND This form matches the provided wireframe.
AND Entering a date of birth with prompt the system to determine if the player the user is creating a profile for is subject to registration or not (using the provided rules). 
AND If the player is subject to registration, then the note "Subject to L1 Reg" appears next to the DOB field. The "Next" button will also be replaced with a "Register" button.  
OR If the player is not subject to registration, then the note "Not Subject to L1 Reg" appears next to the DOB fields. The "Next" button remains a "Next" button. 
AND Any time the user changes the DOB on the form, the system will need to re-check the profile type and make the appropriate updates.
AND Selecting a "Country of Residence" will pre-populate the Birth Country field with the same value. 
AND The Birth Country will remain editable, and updating the Birth Country field will NOT change the Country of Residence.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Requirement

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to edit the First Review for a Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will reload the Registration profile in edit mode. This will include the "Registration Reviews" section - which does not display in View mode until a value is set for the First Review. (Any other section is outside the scope of this story and may or may not be editable at this time). 
AND If none of the Registration Reviews have ever been edited, then only the First Review field is displayed, and it is blank. 
AND The user is able to set the First Review to any of the available statuses, per the data discovery, including the display of the comments section where relevant. 
AND On Save, the system will store the selected review status. 
AND If "Pre-Verified" was selected as the status, Club users continue to see whatever the prior status was, according to the rules. 
OR If Pre-Verified" or "Verified" is selected as the status, when the user next loads the profile, this field is locked and uneditable.
OR If any other status is selected as the status, when the user next loads the profile, this field remains open and editable - and the Second Review field is NOT available.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master (scroll down to edit mode)

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Statuses

*Note that the rule that prevents users from verifying during certain points of the year is NOT included in this. This story assumes it is always available.*

title: As a prod user I don't want to see any of the new International Amateur functionality until we are going to production
custom_preconds: GIVEN prod user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user attempts to view new International Amateur functionality anywhere in the system
custom_expected: THEN Developers should have a way to show/hide the new International Amateur code without impacting the existing code/functionality.

title: As a user I want to be able to make the player's email address the same as trainer's
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC and club user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN there is a button on the email section that says "Make Same as Trainer". 
AND Clicking this will prepopulate the email address field with the entered trainer/agent or league's email address.
AND The "Type" will also be set to "Trainer/Agent" instead of whatever it is currently set to.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master (scroll down to the email section in edit mode)

title: As a user I want to be able to make the player's phone number the same as trainer's
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN there is a button on the phone number section that says "Make Same as Trainer". 
AND Clicking this will prepopulate the phone number field with the entered trainer/agent or league's phone number, including the country.
AND The "Type" will also be set to "Trainer/Agent" instead of whatever it is currently set to.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master (scroll down to the phone section in edit mode)

title: As a user I want to be able to make the player's address the same as their birth address
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN there is a button on the address section that says "Same as Birth Address". 
AND Clicking this will prepopulate the Country, State and City fields of the address with those entered in the Birth Country/State/City (or whatever the counterpart is for that particular country) in the address section.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master (scroll down to the address section in edit mode)

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to complete the Second Review for a Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN For any profile that has the "First Review" set to either "Pre-Verified" or "Verified", the "Second Review" field should be available in edit mode. It should not be visible in view mode until a value is stored for the Second Review. 
AND If the second review has never been edited, then it is blank. 
AND The user is able to set the Second Review to any of the available statuses, per the data discovery, including the display of the comments section where relevant. 
AND On Save, the system will store the selected review status. 
AND If "Verified" is selected as the status, when the user next loads the profile, this field is locked and uneditable.
OR If any other status is selected as the status, when the user next loads the profile, this field remains open and editable - and the Third Review field is NOT available.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to complete the Third Review for a Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile with the "Second Review" set to "Verified"
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THAN the "Third Review" field should be available in edit mode. It should not be visible in view mode until a value is stored for the Third Review. 
AND If the third review has never been edited, then it is blank. 
AND The user is able to set the Third Review to any of the available statuses, per the data discovery, including the display of the comments section where relevant. 
AND On Save, the system will store the selected review status. 
AND Regardless of which status is selected and saved, the Third Review remains open and editable.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master (scroll down to edit mode)

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Registration+Statuses

title: As a user I want to see an error if I do not enter comments on a MN 60 Day DL placement that has an Injury reason of "Other"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user logs in with DL permission
AND user initiates a MN 60 Day DL transaction with Injury Description or Ailment fields set to "Other"
AND user doesn't enter any comments
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" on a MN Place on 60 Day DL transaction
custom_expected:
THEN system will check to see if any of the Injury Description or Ailment fields have been set to "Other". 
AND If yes, display Messages #92. 
AND This error should be overridable for Clubs if comments have been entered, otherwise it is a hard error for them. 
AND This error should always be overridable for the BOC.

Messages #92: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages

Business Rules #15.11.2: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/15.+Place+on+60-Day+DL

AND user doesn't enter any comments

AND This error should always be overrideable for the BOC.

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/DL+-+Messages

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/1.+Verify+DL+Placement+Date

title: As a Club user I want to receive a hard error if no last game date is entered for a minor league DL placement
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and club user logged in with permission to create a minor league DL placement transaction
AND User is placing a player on a 7 Day DL or 60 Day DL transactions at MN level
AND the "Last Game Date" field is blank for the transactions
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Submit" or "Approve" button on a MN DL placement
custom_expected:
THEN Clubs user should receive a required field error if it is not populated and not be able to proceed. 
BUT BOC user needs to be able to override this required field error. 
AND No change to this field should be made for the MJ Placements.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Place+on+7+or+60+Day+DL
* On MN Place on 7 Day DL transactions the "Last Game Date" field is prepopulated with the player's last game date based on their stats, but it is editable for both BOC and Clubs.
* On MN Place on 60 Day DL transactions the "Last Game Date" field is prepopulated with the player's last game date based on their stats, but it is editable for both BOC and Clubs.

title: As a BOC user I want to see a "For LRD Purposes Only" field on the Player Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC user is logged in
AND navigates to Player profile
custom_steps: WHEN user Click on "Info" tab
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "For LRD Purposes Only" field on the professional player profile in the "Baseball Info" section. This field should be a checkmark, and not be required. 
AND Users without the view permission cannot see this field.
AND Users without the edit permission cannot edit this field.

title: As a user I want to receive an error message on submit and/or approve of any transaction if the "For LRD Purposes Only" field on the Player Profile is checked for the player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user is logged in 
AND user select player with the "For LRD Purposes only" field on the Player Profile is checked 
AND user opens the Players transaction that in Preliminary or Submitted to BOC Status
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Submit" or "Approve" on the player transaction
custom_expected:
THEN the system should prompt the system to check if the "For LRD Purposes Only" field is checked on the professional player profile. 
AND This should not apply to Employee transactions.
AND If the field is checked, then the system should fire an error. 
AND The error should be "Please contact the Commissioners Office." and should be overrideable by BOC users. 
AND It should be a hard error for Clubs. 
AND This error and warning should be bypassed for the Unconditional Release and Waiver Claim Assignments auto-submitted/approved by the Waiver process.

custom_preconds:

AND user is creating a new MJ contract for the player
custom_steps: WHEN user click "Update Status" button on a MJ Contract to Terms Submitted, Ready for Signature, Terms Confirmed, Pending Approval, Pending Approval (Terms Confirmed) or Approved or Approved for Next Year
custom_expected:
THEN should prompt the system to check if the "For LRD Purposes Only" field is checked on the professional player profile. 
AND If the field is checked, then the system should fire an error. 
AND The error should be "Please contact the Commissioners Office." and should be overrideable by BOC users. 
AND It should be a hard error for Clubs.

title: As a BOC user I want to see the Employee Contract widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Contracts+Widget+-+Data+Discovery
Wireframe: 
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_contracts
GIVEN the Employee Contracts widget is located beneath the Employee Rosters widget on the Employees tab
AND a BOC user is logged in with permission to view the widget
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user loads the Employee Contracts widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should load the widget per the data discovery and the provided wireframe
AND the "Org" filter and column should be present for BOC users
AND BOC Users should be able to view "All" or filter by Org
AND default for "Org" filter should be "All" 
AND the widget should populated with all of the employees that the Org has 
AND the Header "Level" filter should work appropriately
AND widget exports and other default widget behavior should work (export to excel, export to pdf)

title: As a Club user I want to see the Employee Contract widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Contracts+Widget+-+Data+Discovery
Wireframe: 
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_contracts
GIVEN the Employee Contracts widget is located beneath the Employee Rosters widget on the Employees tab
AND a club user is logged in with permission to view the widget
custom_steps: WHEN user loads the Employee Contracts widget as a Club user
custom_expected:
THEN system should load the widget per the data discovery and the provided wireframe
AND the "Org" filter and column should not be present for Club users
AND the widget should be populated with all of the employees that the Org has
AND the "Current Contract" columns should be populated using the employees currently "active" UEC (their Completed, Submit Signed, Approved or Approved for Next Season UEC with the earliest Service Start Date)
AND the "Next Contract" columns should be populated using the employees next UEC, based on whichever UEC has a Service Start date next after the Current's Service Start Date. (Example: if the Employee's current UEC's start date is 1/1/17 and they have subsequent UECs with a start date of 1/18/18 and one with a start date of 1/20/18, display the one with the 1/18/18 date as the "Next").
AND UECs with start dates before the start date of the employee's Current UEC should not be displayed. (Example: if the employee's current UEC's start date is 1/1/17 and they only have a Preliminary UEC with a start date of 1/1/16, no UEC would be displayed in the "Next" columns until a UEC is entered for that employee with a service date equal to or later than the current service start date)
AND if no Service Start date has been entered for a UEC, use the "Starting in Year" field to determine if the UEC is for a Year that falls after the employee's current UEC. If this field is somehow not populated, or is before the current UEC's Service Start Date, system should not display the information for this UEC. If the Starting Year is equal to that of the Service Start Date of the Current UEC, system should display it
AND the Header "Level" filter should work appropriately
AND widget exports and other default widget behavior should work (export to excel, export to PDF)

title: As a user I want to be able to Create a new UEC from the Employee Contract widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or CLUB user has Employee Contract Permission
custom_steps: WHEN use is in Employee Contract widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be Create New Icon next to Employee names
AND user should be able to Create UEC from the Employee Contract widget like the Employee Roster Widget


Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Contracts+Widget+-+Data+Discovery

Wireframe: 
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_contracts
